S.FORM: Malingatu tu a micudad! cumudsa ku pasevana’ay, suwal satu ku pangcang, “katemireng! micemek!”
S.TRANSL: 開始上課了!老師剛走進教室時，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said, “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: Tataang ku nipangiha niyam, “Kapah haw kisu pasevana’ay?”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: I nipicudad, pasevana’an nu pasevana’ay kami tu sasausian nu Pangcah a suwal.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的阿美族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Pangcah language of numbers.

S.FORM: Duduen niyam ku pasevana’ay a remadiw tu sapisa’usi a radiw.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: Adihay tu ku nikavana’an nu maku tu suwal nu Pangcah.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Pangcah languages.

S.FORM: A patengil kaku ci inaan tu nipinanam tu suwal nu Pangcah i cacudadan tu remiremiad.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Pangcah language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: Ci Kacaw ku ngangan nu maku.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是kacaw。
My name is kacaw.

S.FORM: Ci Using ku ngangan ni ama nu maku.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Using。
My dad’s name is Using.

S.FORM: Ci Panay ku ngangan ni ina nu maku.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Panay。
My mother’s name is Panay.

S.FORM: Muktep tu ku mihcaan nu maku i anini a mihca.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: Sikaka kaku tu vavainay cacay, ci Kulas han cira, savaw tu cacay ku mihcaan nira i anini a mihca.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Kulas，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is kulas, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: Malecad ku cacudadan niyam.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: Maulah kami malekaka a remidiw.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: Maulah kaku a midanguy, i pipantangan maruyaruy tu ku luma’ niyam a midanguy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: Maulah kaku a sicavay tu valuhay a cavay, malecavay tu kami a remadiw, a midanguy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: U wawa nu Pangcah kaku.
S.TRANSL: 我是阿美族的小孩。
I am an ’Amis child.

S.FORM: I Rinahemay ku luma’ nu niyam.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在Rinahem。
Our family lives in Rinahem.

S.FORM: U tamdaw nu luma’ nu niyam lalima.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: Tatulu kami a malekaka.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: Makumud ku aru’ nu maku aci ama, ina, atu kaka tu vavainayan, kaka tu vavahiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: Tarakaw ci ama aku, u malakincalay ci ama nu maku.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: Makupit ci ina aku, u ising ci ina nu maku.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: Anu i luma’ tu ci ama, u nu Pangcah tu ku nikasasuwal niyam.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家就會和我們說阿美族語。
My father speaks the Pangcah language with us at home.

S.FORM: I pahanhan nu laludan, taluma’ tu kami i niyaru’.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: Mahekulung kami a malekaka a milepel tu tatakula’.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: Maulah kaku tu tamdaw nu luma’ nu niyam.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: Tahkal a mihulul kaku aci ina i anini a remiad.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: Salangdaw sa ku kakarayan i remiadan, carangcang aca ku remiad.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣也風和日麗。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: Maru’ kami a kemaen tu pan i sirengusay a seraan, sadiheku saan ku tireng a mapacidal
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: Salahengan satu ku kakarayan i herek nu kalahukan.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: Palitaen nu maku ci ina, kiya u lahngangay saw ku kulit nu kakarayan?
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空的顏色是紅色的？
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: Suwal satu ci ina, kay a initu ku valiyus.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: Awaay ku kutem i lavii, sadak satu ku vuis.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: A taluma’ tu kita.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: I vatad tu sakataluma’ a lalanan, milunguc kaku tu vuis.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: Akaa katayni ku valiyus nasa kaku, a managlay hen kaku a mihulul kiyami.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來!我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: I tapiingan nu luma’ ku cacudadan niyam, rakaten nu maku a talacacudadan, rakaten aca a taluma’ tu remiremiad.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: Caay katataang ku cacudadan nu niyam, caay kaaluman ku micudaday, u masasuvana’ tu amin kami.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: Malecapu amin ku adiwawa i kavekacan a mimali, a masasuwasuwal.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: Mikihatiya ku pasevana’ay i tamiyan a mahekulung a malehulul, matiya sa u malecacayay a luma’an ku cacudadan.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: Miasik kami tu remiremiad, satamelac han niyam ku nipiasik tu picudadan.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: Simisipuay tu sasingaran, simiasikay nu rumaan a tamdaw.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，另外,有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: Miasik aca kami tu karimucumucuan nu cacudadan, matatahic kami a malalikel a demak, satamelac satu ku cacudadan tu remiremiad.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: Natayra kaku i niyaru’ a milisu’ ci vakian i nacila.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: Matenesay tu kami a caay kasasuaraw, maurun tu kaku i ciraan.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: Melaw saan ci vaki i takuwan, pakaenan kaku tu ciyak, pananuman aca kaku tu ociya.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: Sicedam tu nipalumaan ni vaki tu ciyak, saalesu’ sa a kaenen.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: U maulahay:tu kaku tu ociya ni vaki, alesu’ aca a nananuman.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: Misakalahuk kaku aci vayi aku i kalahukan.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: Adihay ku nicacakan ni vayi tu sakalahuk, sivuting, siayam, sitamurak atu kacumuli.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: Herek sa namalahuk, tayra kami i padatengan a mikituc tu dateng.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: Adihay ku nipaahen ni vayi tu vunga, tali atu lukiyu i takuwan, u sapataluma’ nu maku saan.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: A miliyas hen kaku tu henian, rumaaw tu aca a milisu’ i tu henian.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: Hakulungen nu pasevana’ay kami anini a remiad a tayra i tunguyen, misilsil kami i panan a micakay tu paya.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: Cumud sa hen kami i tunguyen, suwal satu ku pasevana’ay : i aayaway u ayam, u uner ku i lalikulay, ka amu hantu ku misamelamelaway.
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: U matalaway kaku tu uner, sisa ,caay pimelaw kaku tu uner.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: Adihay ku nikamelawan nu maku tu ayam, simarevahuyay i kudul nu kilang, ira aca ku nikamelawan i vuhang nu kilang simaredavu’ay nu tuul.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: Ira ku tasiyang, sevayu, lukedaw, i tunguyen, nahacuwa kaku a makamelaw tu matiniay a aadupen, salipahak sa ku vulucu’ a makamelaw i anini a remiad.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: Adihay ku nipisasing nu maku, u sapamelaw ci amaan aci inaan.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: Anuruma, a mahakulung a tayni aca aci ama atu ina.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: A tayra kaku i Taytung a milisu’ ci vikiyan aku atu kaka tu vavahiyan i tina pihivangan a remiadan.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: Namaka Taypak kami a midakaw tu silamalay a tayra i Taytung.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: Tangasatu i Taytung, parakat ci vaki tu karireng a tayni i pangiruan a militemuh i tamiyan.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: I ngata nu pangiruan ku luma’ ni vaki, caay katenes tangasa tu i luma’.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家很近，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.

S.FORM: Sidadahalay a pahutinan ci vaki i ngata nu luma’, mahakulungay kami a mivatikar i pahutinan.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: I pahutinan, hakulungen ni vaki kami a tayra a pahavay tu siri atu midakaw tu sevayu i pahutinan.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: I lavii, mahakulung kami a tayra i patiyamay a malavi.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: Adihay ku karireng i tukay, manay makaotovay kami a tayra i itila.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: I piliyasan niyam, araw takawen nu tau ku otovay, maanen aca, dakaw satu kami tu vasu a miliyas.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: Tangasatu kami anini i Taypak, matepaay tu hakiya ku otovay ni vaki ?
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: Nanu wawa, na i Rinahem ku luma’ niyam, micudad satu, tayraen i Tawyen a malinah, i tokatokayan satu a maurip.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在光榮部落，上學以後，就搬到了桃園市，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Rinahem. After I started school, we moved to Taoyuan and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: Micudad satu kaku i Tasiye, u serangawan nu Yincumin, ku nitutucan nu maku a minanam, u sakavana’ tu nikasarumaruma a serangawan nu i Taywanay a yaanay ku aru’ a vinacadan.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: Sisa, a taluma’ kaku atu kaka tu vavainayan i pipantangan nina mihca mangalay a milisu’ tu kalas nu niyaru’, mangalay a misapinang tu serangawan nu urip.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: Walu a pulu’ tu ku mihcaan nu matuasay, nika matiya i terungay hen ku mihcaan a melawen.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: Pina saw ku nikavana’an nu misu tu suwal nu rumaan a niyaru’? mavana’ cira a semuwal tunu Ripun, nu Teruku atu nu Ngayngay.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的日語說得很流利，也會說太魯閣族語和客家語。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Teruku, as well as Atayal, Hakka and Ngayngay.

S.FORM: Palita han nu maku cira, araw nanu wawa mavana’tu tu suwal nu Ripun, siramud sa u vavahi nu Teruku, i nikadademak aluman ku cavay nira tu Ngayngay, namahaen hati:la satu ku kavana’an nira tu rumaan a suwal.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是太魯閣族人，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Teruku, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: I nipilisu’ niyam a masasuwal, adihay ku nipasevana’ ni vaki tu kakawaw tunu sakay pivutingan, piadupan a rayrayan.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於漁獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: Kanahatu caay katesek ku nikavana’an niyam tu nipisaheci ni vaki, nika, luingen niyam tu soci, hangay liyawan nu niyam a misapinang a mitengil i luma’.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: Yu wawa hen kami nahacuwa a mavana’ tu serangawan nu tireng, mangudu aca a kavana’an nu tau tu wawa nu Pangcah.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: Adihay ku nikavana’an tu serangawan nu tuas, mangalev ku nikariang a malawawa nu Pangcah, u masacidekay, u kasenengan ku vinacadan nu mita.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為阿美族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a ’Amis is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: I sangsangdev nina remiad, a taluma’ ku sava tu vavainayan.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: Tayra i iciva kaku aci vayi a micakay tu ayam, a micacak tu alesu’ay a sakalavi a pakaen tu vavainayan a sava.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: Mitaeliv kami tu pacakayay tu dateng, adihay ku luengelay a dateng i nipatadaan.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，他擺放了好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: Sinicakay kami tu incay, kuletu atu nincing.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: Ira i teparay a pacakayay tu lusay a tawki suwal saan : “U nipacakayan nu maku tu paringad atu rupas sicedamay yo! picakayi saw atudi!”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: Cakay satu kami tu paringad atu rupas.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: Mitaeliv kami tu pacakayay tu titi, suwal sa kira tawki: A u maan saw ku cakayen nu misu? tataang siheci aca kina ayam anini, tulu a patekenan ku cacayay.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: Matekesen ci vayi, keluli saw atudi saan a mipalita tira tawkian.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: Caay tu katekes isaw saan kira tawki, awaay tu ku kakelulan.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: Katayni i takuwan a micakay tu vuting, saan kira i teparay a tawki, caay katekes, tataak aca ku vuting nu maku saan a semuwal.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: Herek saan kami a micakay tu ayam atu vuting, taluma’ satu cacay a sapadan ku nipatada tu nicacakan tu sinavelan.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: Matenes ku nipitala, araw tueman tu ku remiad.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: Patelay ku sava tu vavainayan, sikavahalan nu kuntay a caay aca pihivang saan, a pakucila tu lalipayan kiya a taluma’ isaw.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: Suwal sa ci vayi adihay ku nicacakan, katien ku alumanay a patayni a kemaen.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: Aluman ku nitakusan niyam tu cavay, kumuday nu mita a miseka tu nisakalavian.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: Ira ku kapaut nu maku ci Kacaw han ku ngangan, hinapawapawan a mikerit ku lalusidan nira.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Kacaw，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Kacaw, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: I nipicudad satu, micaliw cira tu sapisurit, savuric ansa u sasasuritan tu teparay a kaputan.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: Kinacacay, kinatusa, kinatulu, pacaliwantu nu alumanay tu maan i ciraan.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: Nika, siraecusay a wayway cira, namicaliw tu lalusidan caay tu panukas tu nicaliwan.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: Tunamahaen, awaay tu ku pacaliway nu alumanay tu lalusidan nu heni i ciraan.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: Cacay a remiad, mahekulung kami u alumanay a tayra i umaumahan a mihulul.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: I vatad nu lalan, alenih ci Kacaw, nika mapawan cira tu sailus a tatipeluk.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Kacaw想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Kacaw wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: Micaliw cira tu sailus i kaput. Nika, awaay ku nikerida niyam saan a pacauv i ciraan.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.

S.FORM: Taletangictu ci Kacaw a makatengil, macalivat a semuwal cira, kiya caay saw pacaliw tu sailus i takuwan saan.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!!
Kacaw burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: Pacauv han tu nu kaput cira, caay kisu pikerid tu nu tirengay a lausidan kiyami? Iri, nipicaliwan a lalusidan i tisuwan nahacuwa saw kisu a panukas!
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: Pakucila a micudad, maratar ci Kacaw a i cacudadan, panukasen ni Kacaw amin ku nicaliwan tu kaput.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Kacaw很早就到學校了，Kacaw把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Kacaw arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: Sululen kaku saan ci Kacaw tu kaput nira, a mikerid tu kaku tu lausidan nu tireng i nalikulan saan, a miaray aca tu nikangaay nu kaput a pacaliw i ciraan.
S.TRANSL: kacaw向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
kacaw apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: U miadupay nu niyaru’ ku ama nu maku.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: Yu wawa hen kaku, yu tahekal ci ama aci vaki, sinirepet tu hawan atu kuwang ku heni.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: Tangelal sa hen ku remiad, siniawit tu tama’ ku heni a taluma’.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: Yu ruma sa u vavuy nu lutuk, yu ruma sa u rapic, alamaanan ira ku tuluk.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: I luma’ ku heni a mikilac tu tama’ tu sapavatis tu laluma’an.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在家裡把獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: Miucil kaku ci amaan, mangalay a mihakulung ci amaan a miadup.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: Itiyaaw tu a mihakulung anu matuas tu kisu saan ci ama.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: U teker ku sapiadup nu vavainay, mavana’ ku heni a misanga’ tu talakal, tu erid atu taerev.
S.TRANSL: 男人會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: Mavana’ ci ama aku a misateker, u sapiteker tu tuluk ku matuniay saan, a sameteken nu mita a mimelaw ku narakatan nu aadupen, sulinay pacunek han i narakatan nu aadupen a pateli.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: Makalah kaku a matuas saan, kiya a hakulungen nu matuasay a miadup, saremiad satu kaku a minanam a misanga’ tu tatekeran, sulinay, sinikalepelan tu aadupen ku nisanga’an nu maku a teker.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: Melaw sa ci ama i takuwan, Suwal sa : A u tatadaanay a miadupay kisu i rumaan a remiad.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: Matuas tu kaku anini, caelayen nu maku ku pana’ a mihakulung ci amaan a tayra a miadup.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: Taluma’ sa i niyaru’ kilacen niyam ku tama’ a pavatis tu laluma’an.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物切割和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: Suwal sa ci ama, “A mivetik kita tu nipalemed nu kawas tu nikarahid nu mita a ira ku sakataluma’ a tama’.”
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: Namautang kaku a talacacudadan i nadavak.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: Mapawan kaku a sikavang, natala i cacudadan.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: Awaawa ku nikerid nu maku tu maamaan.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn’t bring anything with me.

S.FORM: I namicudad, mahkulung kaku atu kaput a mimelaw tu cudad.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: I pisekingan, pacaliwan nu kaput kaku tu sapisurit atu savuric.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: Pasuwal satu ku pasevan’ay itakuwan, “akaa tu kautang, karatar tu a lumuwad haw!”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「不要再遲到了，下次早點起床!」
The teacher told me, “Wake up earlier next time and don’t be late again!”

S.FORM: U sakapahay nu maku a cavay ci Kacaw, u wawa: nu Pangcah cira.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Kacaw，他也是阿美族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Kacaw, and he is also an Amis child.

S.FORM: Malecavayay kami a micadad i Rinahem.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在光榮部落讀書。
We study together in the Rinahem tribe.

S.FORM: Mahkulungay tu kami a mitengil tu nipakungku nu kalas, u mavana’:ay kami a misanuPangcah.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說阿美語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Amis proficiently.

S.FORM: Tarakaw, masusu aca kaku, puener, makupit aca ci Kacaw.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Kacaw很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Kacaw is short and thin.

S.FORM: U masakapahay ci Kacaw, manay, aluman ku maulahay i ciraan.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Kacaw is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: Miundukay ku cacudadan anini, manay adihay ku nikacacavi i cacudadan.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: Ira ku mamaviyangaay, mimaliay, mavakacay, misakeruay, mipana’ay.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河的、打球的、跑步的、跳舞的和射箭的。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: Madademec kaku a mavakec.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: Namatulu’ kaku namavekac, tanu remes satu ku tusur nu maku.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: Nika, lumuwad kaku, a taleayaw aca a mavekac.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: Tanu lipahak satu ku alumanay tu nikatangsa nu maku.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: Kanahatu caay kaw saayaway kaku, nika lipahak kaku, namaherekay tu kaku namadademec kiyami.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: Namahkulung kaku aci ama nu maku a milisu’ ci ama ci Kacaw i nacila.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔Kacaw。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: Madukaay ku kuku’ ni ama ni Kacaw.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: Mavuhang ku vadahung nu luma’ saan cira i tamiyan.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: Matevaday cira namakayra i vadahung, namisanga’ tu vadahung saan.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: Siniawit ci ama tu titi nu rarapa atu icep, u sapaveli i ci ama ci Kacaw.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給Kacaw叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: Natayra i luma’ ni ama ni Kacaw kaku i nacila, adihay ku nipakungku nira.
S.TRANSL: 我昨天去Kacaw叔叔家聊天時 ，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: Kaw rarutu kaku, suwal satu ci ama ci Kacaw itakuwan, mavatac tu kisu, tanestes tu kisu saan.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，Kacaw叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: Anu kapah tu ku kuku’ nu misu, tayni han tu i luma’ a mihulul han aku ci ama ci Kacaw.
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: I 2022 a mihcaan, namiluvang ku ceng-fu tu madengay a cacayen ku nipangangan tu ngangan nu Yincumin i muvinsiw.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: Namipalita kaku ci kulas Vutingan tu matenesay a madademec tu ceng-fu a sacacayen ku sakasingangan i muvinsiw nu Yincumin.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Kulas Vuting。
I interviewed Noami Kulas, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: A malitemuh kami i pihivangan, a tayra i luma’ nira a mipalita i ciraan.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: Namipalita kaku i ciraan, pasuwal sa tu nikasingangan nira, pasasuaraw aca i takuwan tu lalavu’ nu luma’ atu niyaru’ nira.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: Palita han aku cira, kiya mangalay a misumad tu ngangan, u nihaenan tu a nipangangan i, caay haw kakapah?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: Suwal satu itakuwan, u nisuritan a ngangan tu nu Hulam, caay kasipinang tu tadangangan nira, u ruma satu ira ku mitadihangaay i ciraan tu Ku-syen-sen saan, manay, u sasakemutan nu tau.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Ku Xian Sheng

S.FORM: Suwal satu ci Kulas Vuting “u surit nu Yincumin ku tadangangan nu mita. U ngasaw nu mita, u lalavu’ nu luma’ nu mita, u nu urip tu nu mita, ngay alumanaluman tu ku singanganay tu ngangan nu urip.”
S.TRANSL: our family
Kulas Vuting said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: Namihkulung aku aci vayian talaiciva inacila, adihay ku nialaan nira tu nipalumaan a dateng, ira aca ku nicacakan tu alesu’ay a kakaenan nu Yincumin a sapasisi tu alumanay.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食分享給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: Maulah ku alumanay tu papacakayan ni vayi, sisa, aluman ku micakayay tu cupel atu adeci, maulah aca mitanam tu nisasinavelan nira.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和箭筍很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: Alesu’ kiyami ku nisakavi’an nira tu nu vataan atu hakhak, ira aca ku nipalamlaman tu siraw a kavi nu adeci, sisa, makasanek tu ku lavang a masasilsil a tayni a micakay.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的樹豆湯和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用醃豬肉煮的箭筍湯，味道吸引了很多客人排隊來買。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: Anu misacacak tu ci vayi, i tepar tu kaku a miangang tu lavang. Kalamkamen a tayni a micakay tu nipalumaan nu niyam tu tadadateng nu Pangcah han aku ku micakayay.
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: A mamin tu ku sapacakay nu niyam, suwal satu ci vayi, “iraay kisu itini a mipadang kiyami.”
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: Pakayni i tina kaludemakan a mavana’ kaku tu kavana’an tu pinalengaw, kakaenen nu Yincunmin, pasu, u ngeru’ nu pacakayay.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: U mahemekay, u malemeday kaku namakamelaw tu nikavana’an ni vayi a misacacak tu kakaenen nu Pangcah.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對阿美族傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
